body: SHE ought to start carrying tissues wherever she goes, the young New York woman was saying between sniffles. The tears seem to flow all the time these days. With a needless apology, she took the offer of a tissue and talked about why she cries. No names, please, she said. It would mean identifying her father, a Long Island man in the early stages
title: N.Y.C.; Alzheimer's, With Tears On the Side

body: On a September afternoon more than eight years ago, Vincent Bickelman was found dead, shot six times while on the lawn in front of his Bath Beach home, in what police described at the time as a mysterious killing. But yesterday law enforcement officials said they believed that Mr. Bickelman's fatal mistake came a month earlier when he burglarized
title: 1991 Killing Is Said To Be Revenge for Robbery of Mob Figure's Daughter

body: ELVIA SUTER was strolling down Bay 54th Street, a dead-end block in the tiny Brooklyn community of White Sands, when she stopped and gestured toward a 50-foot oak tree. An abandoned blue Chrysler filled with garbage was parked next to it. ''See this tree here?'' asked Ms. Suter, a vigorous 82-year-old with salt-and-pepper hair. ''When my son was 8,
title: Swept Away

body: NO ONE thought Mike Riezenman, 58, would ever get married. He had many passions -- Sherlock Holmes, Gilbert and Sullivan, wry jokes and Chinese food -- but domesticity was not one of them. For 20 years he had lived alone in a small, cluttered Manhattan apartment at 55th and Broadway. ''I lived in typical or worse than typical bachelor disorder,''
title: WEDDINGS: VOWS; Paula Engel, Mike Riezenman

body: Great Rubel Robbery Q. The building where I work, at Bay 19th Street and Cropsey Avenue in Bath Beach, Brooklyn, was once occupied by the Rubel Coal and Ice Company. I understand that a famous armed robbery occurred there in the 1930's. Do you have details? A. Just after noon on Aug. 21, 1934, an armored truck pulled up outside the 90-foot-long
title: F.Y.I.

body: An off-duty firefighter was found shot to death yesterday in the driver's seat of his Jeep in an industrial area of Long Island City, Queens, the police said. Brendan Brooks, 21, a probationary firefighter who joined the department last November and was assigned to Ladder Company 104 in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, was shot in the head, chest and
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Off-Duty Firefighter Shot to Death in Queens

body: William and Diane Perez escaped the heat in their Brooklyn home yesterday afternoon for a trip to the past. Their vehicle was a movie, but as they snuggled into their seats at the nearby Fortway Cinemas in Bay Ridge, it was clear that they had come to experience something much greater. They were there to relive 1977, the most memorable year of
title: Filmgoers Revisit a Summer They Couldn't Forget

body: LIKE it's namesake, Bath, the spa town in England, Bath Beach is a tranquil place. But it is no longer the resort area it was a century ago. The beach itself was eradicated in a postwar building boom, and largely replaced by housing on a landfill. Now it is primarily residential with a walkway along the waterfront and a view of Coney Island across
title: If You're Thinking of Living In /Bath Beach, Brooklyn; Once a Bayfront Resort, Now Residential
